ratings.comment: Average on tests was super low did very little to compensate. Try's to seem like she cares about successes but she does not and never sees her teaching as the issue.

Misha's lectures were confusing. Although you have to go, since attendance points count in your grade, I recommend mostly spacing out. Focus on memorizing the weekly homework quiz questions and answers. She reuses the same questions from the homeworks for the quizzes and the exams, so as long as you know those well you will do well in the class.

She spends lots of time on some topics and skips over others. There's lots of reading too and random in-class graded assignments, so attendance is necessary. She also never answers her emails and was very unorganized when communicating with me about my accommodations. She took weeks to release exam scores and doesn't show the correct answers.

The lectures were slow paced, didn't cover the material they needed to. We often had hour and a half videos to watch as homework. Additionally, you must watch 5 videos and create 5 responses then respond to 5 classmates discussion responses..This was very much busy work. The class material was overall interesting though.

Finney was boring. The exams and lecture would be great for those taking a advanced level class, but for an intro class she went very in depth and expected us to know too much info. It was very hard to memorize everything. She was never able to finish slideshows bc she talked too much. I don't recommend, it was not an interesting intro class.

Prof Finney is knowledgeable in her field and passionate about comm disorders. You definitely need to read the textbook because the weekly quizzes are based on it. She doesn't post whole lecture slides instead, there are blanks in the slides which is a little frustrating. As someone who isn't in STEM, this class was difficult, but also interesting.

I've had Dr. Finney for so many of my classes and she seriously is the best. Her teaching style is clear and concise and she makes it clear what she wants from you. Even with the pandemic, she's been so organized. My CSD classes are the most organized and clear. She sympathetic and understanding. Can't recommend enough.

my favorite professor at UW! csd 110 is very easy. just show up! we were graded on tests mostly, that were taken outside of class. there were random checks for attendance, but lecture was interesting and I enjoyed the class! misha is very sweet, I met her on the first day and we caught up frequently throughout the sem. she is very knowledgeable !

I have taken courses with Misha in the past, but I thought 315 was weirdly l hard. The books were super dense and the amount of material we had to know was kind of insane at some points. Also, the final is cumulative. I really like Misha but I think she could have been a better job of organizing, structuring, and connecting the material.

Her lecture slides are so busy and repetitive that they're unhelpful. She as a person is very scatterbrained and all over the place with her examples. Often, students persistently do not understand an example she gives and she is very dismissive and does not offer another viewpoint to help students understand. Nice person, but a terrible professor.

This class is suuuuuuper easy AS LONG AS YOU SHOW UP! She posts the slides with blanks that are only available in class. I always typed the notes early so I only had to pay attention for when she changed the slides to fill in the words I was missing. Take advantage of the extra credit and there's no reason you shouldn't get an A

Misha is one of my favorite professors. She really does care about her students and she treats us like equals. She truly is knowledgeable about the field even though she is a little scatterbrained sometimes. I thought she did a good job of applying real life scenarios to the material in 318. Overall, one of the easier CSD classes I've taken.

Mianisha was by far my favorite professor last semester. Her lectures were never boring and she was super understanding when I was too sick and missed a test. She explains topics throughly and clearly.

I loved this class and the professor! She was super nice and was always very helpful whenever I had questions. There are 13 in-class assignments so going to class is a must. The exams are online, and all the material is taught in lecture.

Dr. Finney is a wonderful person and professor! I can confidently say that Misha is one of the only professores I have ever had that truly seems to care about her students and how they feel about the class. Tests and quizzes can be a little tricky, but totally fair if you study your lecture notes and the textbook!

Very unorganized. Lecture slides are all formatted differently and don't continue off of each other. Ask her a question outside of the powerpoint? She won't know. Yes, she is extremely personable and caring, but she really, really needs to improve her organization. I learned nothing in this class.

Super friendly and funny lady. The class itself didn't interest me a lot but it was super easy and she wanted everyone to do good in the class. Every once in a while she does participation activities in lecture that can really affect your grade if you miss them, so try to go to class. Good intro classs.

Dr. Finney is a really kind person and, like many other CS&D professors in the university, gives good grades. She is really clear with the grading and material covered in class. I am also impressed by her efforts in instructing this class; she view every comment a student leaves. Take her classes if you can.

I loved Dr. Finney! She's an absolute sweetheart who truly listens to her students, wants them to do well, and takes into account student feedback. CSD is a relatively easy and straightforward class, exams and homework are all multiple choice, online, and open-note. Would recommend this class for an easy social science credit and as a good intro.

Very nice lady who cares about her students and if they do well in her class. Her lectures can be a bit slow at times. All tests are taken out of class and are open notes. Textbook rarely used but only for select quizzes. Powerpoint notes cover mostly all material. Multiple opportunities to do well in her class.
Misha is a really nice lady who you can tell really does care about her students. The class itself is pretty easy and the tests, homework, and quizzes are all open notes

Really nice prof! She gives really good feed backs and do one-on-one meetings with some students like me, and she's really easy-going and gave me twice second-chances for hw just because I sat at the first row in her lectures!

This was not only an easy class but an interesting class. Professor Finney is by far one of the best professors I have ever had. Her class held lectures but the homework, exams, quizzes, and discussions were online. You use the book quite a bit but the homework is very manageable. I will be taking another one of her classes just to have her again.

Professor Finney truly cares about her students and their grades. She was my favorite professor last year and would highly recommend taking her class. Attendance is not required but there will be surprise "in class assignments" to will be graded and count towards your final grade. All your quizzes and exams are online.

Finney makes it easy to do well in her class. Exams are straight out of the textbook- read and you'll be fine. Lectures aren't super helpful-slides are basically the textbook. If you go to lec she occasionally has in-class activities for easy points though. 3 exams, 1 final, open-note quiz once a week, 2 short-answer assignments.
Professor Finney was a great professor! She is very helpful and definitely passionate and knowledgeable about what she teaches.

This was Prof. Finney's first time teaching this course, and it was unorganized in the beginning. The lectures were taken straight out of the textbook, and there were quite a few wrong/debatable answers on answer keys. Though EC is offered, 75% of your grade is 3 exams. She definitely cares for her students, but the course could have been better.

Lectures tend to drag but she gives outlines and all you have to do is fill in the blanks. She is clearly passionate about what she does and knows the material well. This class can be a little boring but provides a good overview for prospective majors. If you pay attention and do the work it's an easy A!

This class is an easy A if you're interested in the topic and the work load is very very easy. You have to go to class because notes are online but you have to fill in the missing parts. Professor Finney is very kind and passionate if you get to know her on a personal level.  Lectures are sometimes boring but to a CS&D major very interesting.

CSD 110 was interesting, but lectures were really boring. Professor Finney is passionate about the subject and she definitely cares about her students. However, she often seems like she has no clue what she is doing and her lectures are quite boring. Class is an Easy A, though.
